response: "{ \"title\": \"Reversed Words Checker (Medium)\", \"description\": \"Write a function `is_reversed_words` that checks if a given string consists of words that read the same forwards and backwards. The string may contain spaces, commas, periods, question marks, exclamation points, hyphens, underscores, and single quotes. Spaces, punctuation, and special characters should be ignored when checking for palindromes.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_reversed_words(s: str) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `s` (str): A string containing words separated by spaces, punctuation, and special characters.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if all the words in the input string are palindromes, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"import re\\ndef is_reversed_words(s: str) -> bool:\\n    # Remove non-word characters from the string and split it into a list of words\\n    words = re.findall(r'b(\\w+)b', s.lower())\\n    # Check each word to see if it reads the same forwards and backwards\\n    return all([word == word[::-1] for word in words])\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_reversed_words('A man, a palindrome, a man') == True\", \"assert is_reversed_words('racecar, radarr') == True\", \"assert is_reversed_words('hello, world') == False\", \"assert is_reversed_words('No \\'x\\' in Nixon') == True\"] }"
